section.section: Except as otherwise provided in paragraphs (2) and (3) of this subsection, a purchasing group is subject to all applicable laws of the State.

A purchasing group that meets the criteria established under the federal Liability Risk Retention Amendments of 1986 is exempt from any law of the State that relates to the creation of groups for the purchase of insurance, prohibition of group purchasing, or any law that would discriminate against a purchasing group or its members.

An insurer is exempt from any law of the State that prohibits providing or offering to provide to a purchasing group or its members advantages based on their loss and expense experience that are not afforded to other persons with respect to rates, policy forms, coverages, or other matters.
Before doing business in the State, a purchasing group shall furnish notice to the Commissioner.
Within 10 days of a change in an item set forth in paragraph (2) of this subsection, the purchasing group shall notify the Commissioner of the change in writing.
A purchasing group shall provide to the Commissioner a statement of registration that designates the Commissioner as its agent for service of legal process.
The Commissioner shall determine the filing fee for the statement of registration required by paragraph (1) of this subsection.

The requirements of paragraph (1) of this subsection do not apply to a purchasing group that:
was a purchasing group under the requirements of the Product Liability Risk Retention Act of 1981 on or before October 26, 1986; and
only purchases insurance that was authorized under the Product Liability Risk Retention Act of 1981, as in effect on or before October 26, 1986.

Unless the purchase is effected through a licensed insurance producer acting under the surplus lines insurance laws and regulations of a state, a purchasing group may not purchase insurance from a risk retention group that is not chartered in that state or from an insurer not authorized in the state in which the purchasing group is located.

A purchasing group that obtains liability insurance from an unauthorized insurer or from a risk retention group shall inform each member of the purchasing group that has a risk resident or located in this State that:
the risk is not protected by the Property and Casualty Insurance Guaranty Corporation; and
the risk retention group or unauthorized insurer may not be subject to all insurance laws and regulations of the State.
A purchasing group may not purchase insurance coverage that provides for a deductible or self-insured retention applicable to the purchasing group as a whole.
Notwithstanding subparagraph (i) of this paragraph, a purchasing group may purchase insurance coverage that provides for a deductible or self-insured retention applicable to individual members.
Taxes on premiums paid for coverage of risks resident or located in the State by a purchasing group or member of the purchasing group shall be imposed in accordance with Title 6 of this article.
If the taxes imposed by Title 6 of this article are not paid by the insurer, then the taxes shall be paid by the purchasing group.
If the purchasing group fails to pay the specified taxes, the taxes shall be paid by each of the purchasing group's members whose risks are resident or located in the State.
